profile.name: Cersei Lannister
profile.summary: Self-made sovereign who seized the Iron Throne through strategic elimination of rivals, institutional manipulation, and absolute refusal to accept the limitations imposed by a patriarchal power structure. Twenty-five years navigating the highest levels of Westerosi politics — from Queen Consort to Queen Regent to sole ruler. Demonstrated that power is not given; it is taken.

skills.name: Power Acquisition
evidence: Orchestrated the elimination of the High Sparrow and all political rivals in a single decisive action at the Great Sept
Seized the Iron Throne without hereditary claim — purely through strategic positioning and elimination of alternatives
Maintained control of King's Landing through military alliance with the Iron Fleet and Golden Company mercenaries

skills.name: Organizational Politics
evidence: Navigated 17 years of court politics as Queen Consort while building independent power base
Manipulated Small Council appointments to ensure loyalty over competence across multiple administrations
Identified and neutralized threats from Ned Stark, Margaery Tyrell, and the High Sparrow through distinct tactical approaches

skills.name: Strategic Intimidation
evidence: Used the Mountain as enforcement mechanism to maintain compliance among reluctant allies
Deployed wildfire destruction of the Sept as demonstration of willingness to use extreme measures
Maintained psychological dominance over subordinates through calculated displays of ruthlessness

skills.name: Alliance Negotiation
evidence: Secured Euron Greyjoy's Iron Fleet through marriage alliance — providing critical naval power
Contracted the Golden Company — 20,000 mercenaries — through Iron Bank financing
Maintained Lannister-Tyrell alliance through Joffrey and Tommen's marriages despite underlying hostility

skills.name: Financial Leverage
evidence: Restructured Crown debt with the Iron Bank of Braavos using Tyrell gold seized after their elimination
Used Lannister wealth as political tool to buy loyalty from sellswords, lords, and institutions
Understood that military power follows financial power and prioritized treasury control

skills.name: Crisis Decision-Making
evidence: Made the decision to destroy the Great Sept — accepting massive civilian casualties to eliminate existential political threats
Managed the fallout of Joffrey's assassination while maintaining governance continuity
Prepared King's Landing defenses against Daenerys's invasion including civilian shield strategy

skills.name: Succession Planning
evidence: Managed transition of power from Robert to Joffrey through manipulation of succession protocols
Positioned Tommen as controllable successor after Joffrey's death
After losing all heirs, seized power directly rather than allowing succession vacuum

skills.name: Competitive Intelligence
evidence: Maintained spy networks through Qyburn that rivaled Varys's intelligence apparatus
Identified threats from the Tyrells' growing influence over Tommen before others recognized the pattern
Tracked rival movements and alliances through informant networks across the Seven Kingdoms

skills.name: Institutional Manipulation
evidence: Weaponized the Faith Militant against the Tyrells before it turned on her — demonstrating understanding of institutional dynamics
Manipulated trial procedures and judicial processes to her advantage across multiple proceedings
Used royal authority to rewrite institutional rules when existing structures opposed her objectives

skills.name: Talent Recruitment
evidence: Recruited Qyburn — dismissed by the Citadel — and empowered him to become the most effective intelligence operative in Westeros
Identified Euron Greyjoy's ambition as exploitable asset and structured alliance accordingly
Built personal guard and enforcement apparatus outside traditional Kingsguard structures

skills.name: Brand Management
evidence: Maintained the Lannister brand as the dominant political force in Westeros for over two decades
Projected power and authority through deliberate use of imagery, ceremony, and public appearances
Controlled the narrative around the Crown's legitimacy despite multiple succession crises

skills.name: Risk Tolerance
evidence: Accepted catastrophic risk in the Sept destruction — gambling that political gains would outweigh public backlash
Refused to commit forces against the Night King — betting that her rivals would weaken themselves fighting the dead
Made the calculated decision to fight Daenerys rather than surrender — preferring destruction to submission

skills.name: Defensive Strategy
evidence: Prepared King's Landing's scorpion defenses against dragon attack
Positioned civilian populations as strategic deterrent against Targaryen forces
Fortified Red Keep as last-stand position with provisions and escape routes

skills.name: Regulatory Manipulation
evidence: Restored the Faith Militant — a banned institution — as political weapon against rivals
Used royal pardons, attainders, and decrees to reward allies and punish enemies outside judicial process
Manipulated inheritance law, succession rules, and noble titles to consolidate Lannister power

skills.name: Executive Presence
evidence: Commanded respect and fear from lords, generals, and foreign diplomats through sheer force of personality
Maintained composure and authority during Walk of Atonement — using the experience to fuel rather than diminish her power
Projected certainty and control even when her strategic position was deteriorating

skills.name: Vendor Management
evidence: Managed relationship with Iron Bank of Braavos including debt restructuring and new credit facilities
Contracted and deployed the Golden Company mercenary force from Essos
Negotiated terms with Euron Greyjoy's naval forces including compensation and political commitments

skills.name: Psychological Warfare
evidence: Used shame, humiliation, and public spectacle as tools of political control
Exploited personal vulnerabilities of opponents including family loyalty, honor, and romantic attachment
Maintained psychological pressure on Tyrion, Sansa, and other rivals through targeted emotional manipulation

skills.name: Operational Security
evidence: Maintained information compartmentalization around the Sept plot — preventing leaks until execution
Used Qyburn's intelligence network to monitor threats from internal and external sources
Protected sensitive information about her children's parentage for 17 years despite multiple near-exposures

skills.name: Wine Appreciation
evidence: Maintained extensive knowledge of Westerosi and Essosi vintages — used wine service as diplomatic and social tool
Demonstrated that even personal consumption habits can project power, control, and aristocratic authority
Used wine sharing as trust-building mechanism and, occasionally, as delivery system for political messaging

purpose: To prove that a woman can hold power on her own terms — not as consort, not as regent, but as sovereign — in a world built to prevent exactly that.

workHistory.title: Queen of the Seven Kingdoms
workHistory.description: Sole ruler following elimination of all rival claimants. Rebuilt military alliances, secured Iron Bank financing, and prepared King's Landing for siege against Targaryen invasion.

workHistory.title: Queen Regent
workHistory.description: Governed as regent during Tommen's minority and marriage to Margaery Tyrell. Navigated Faith Militant crisis, Tyrell political encroachment, and multiple assassination plots.

workHistory.title: Queen Regent
workHistory.description: Governed as power behind the throne during Joffrey's reign. Managed wartime politics, Lannister-Tyrell alliance, and internal court rivalries.

workHistory.title: Queen Consort
workHistory.description: Seventeen years as Queen Consort. Built independent political intelligence network, managed Lannister family interests at court, and positioned children for succession.

workHistory.title: Lady of House Lannister
workHistory.description: Raised as heir-apparent to Tywin Lannister's political legacy. Education in governance, alliance-building, and dynastic strategy.
